sn36.14:4.1: “Mendicants, suppose there was a guest house.
sn36.14:4.2: Lodgers come from the east, west, north, and south.
sn36.14:4.3: Aristocrats, brahmins, merchants, and workers all stay there.
sn36.14:4.4: In the same way, various feelings arise in this body: pleasant, painful, and neutral feelings.
sn36.14:4.6: Also carnal pleasant, painful, and neutral feelings arise.
sn36.14:4.7: Also spiritual pleasant, painful, and neutral feelings arise.”
